metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: HTML Input Attributes
This chapter describes the different attributes for the HTML <input> element.
content.html: This chapter describes the different attributes for the HTML <input> element.

content.text: The value Attribute
The input value attribute specifies an initial value for an input field:
content.html: The input value attribute specifies an initial value for an input field:

content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="fname">First name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname" value="John"><br>
  <label for="lname">Last name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="lname" name="lname" value="Doe">
</form>

content.text: The readonly Attribute
The input readonly attribute specifies that an input field is read-only.
content.html: The input readonly attribute specifies that an input field is read-only.

content.text: A read-only input field cannot be modified (however, a user can tab to it, highlight it, and copy the text from it).
content.html: A read-only input field cannot be modified (however, a user can tab to it, highlight it, and copy the text from it).

content.text: The value of a read-only input field will be sent when submitting the form!
content.html: The value of a read-only input field will be sent when submitting the form!

content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="fname">First name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname" value="John" readonly><br>
  <label for="lname">Last name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="lname" name="lname" value="Doe">
</form>

content.text: The disabled Attribute
The input disabled attribute specifies that an input field should be disabled.
content.html: The input disabled attribute specifies that an input field should be disabled.

content.text: A disabled input field is unusable and un-clickable.
content.html: A disabled input field is unusable and un-clickable.

content.text: The value of a disabled input field will not be sent when submitting the form!
content.html: The value of a disabled input field will not be sent when submitting the form!

content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="fname">First name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname" value="John" disabled><br>
  <label for="lname">Last name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="lname" name="lname" value="Doe">
</form>

content.text: The size Attribute
The input size attribute specifies the visible width, in characters, of an input field.
content.html: The input size attribute specifies the visible width, in characters, of an input field.

content.text: The default value for size is 20.
content.html: The default value for size is 20.

content.text: Note: The size attribute works with the following input types: text, search, tel, url, email, and password.
content.html: Note: The size attribute works with the following input types: text, search, tel, url, email, and password.

content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="fname">First name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname" size="50"><br>
  <label for="pin">PIN:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="pin" name="pin" size="4">
</form>

content.text: The maxlength Attribute
The input maxlength attribute specifies the maximum number of characters allowed in an input field.
content.html: The input maxlength attribute specifies the maximum number of characters allowed in an input field.

content.text: Note: When a maxlength is set, the input field will not accept more than the specified number of characters. However, this attribute does not provide any feedback. So, if you want to alert the user, you must write JavaScript code.
content.html: Note: When a maxlength is set, the input field will not accept more than the specified number of characters. However, this attribute does not provide any feedback. So, if you want to alert the user, you must write JavaScript code.

content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="fname">First name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname" size="50"><br>
  <label for="pin">PIN:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="pin" name="pin" maxlength="4" size="4">
</form>

content.text: The min and max Attributes
The input min and max attributes specify the minimum and maximum values for an input field.
content.html: The input min and max attributes specify the minimum and maximum values for an input field.

content.text: The min and max attributes work with the following input types: number, range, date, datetime-local, month, time and week.
content.html: The min and max attributes work with the following input types: number, range, date, datetime-local, month, time and week.

content.text: Tip: Use the max and min attributes together to create a range of legal values.
content.html: Tip: Use the max and min attributes together to create a range of legal values.

content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="datemax">Enter a date before 1980-01-01:</label>
  <input type="date" id="datemax" name="datemax" max="1979-12-31"><br><br>

  <label for="datemin">Enter a date after 2000-01-01:</label>
  <input type="date" id="datemin" name="datemin" min="2000-01-02"><br><br>

  <label for="quantity">Quantity (between 1 and 5):</label>
  <input type="number" id="quantity" name="quantity" min="1" max="5">
</form>

content.text: The multiple Attribute
The input multiple attribute specifies that the user is allowed to enter more than one value in an input field.
content.html: The input multiple attribute specifies that the user is allowed to enter more than one value in an input field.

content.text: The multiple attribute works with the following input types: email, and file.
content.html: The multiple attribute works with the following input types: email, and file.

content.code:
<form>
  <label for="files">Select files:</label>
  <input 
type="file" id="files" name="files" multiple>
</form>
content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="files">Select files:</label>
  <input type="file" id="files" name="files" multiple>
</form>

content.text: The pattern Attribute
The input pattern attribute specifies a regular expression that the input field's value is checked against, when the form is submitted.
content.html: The input pattern attribute specifies a regular expression that the input field's value is checked against, when the form is submitted.

content.text: The pattern attribute works with the following input types: text, date, search, url, tel, email, and password.
content.html: The pattern attribute works with the following input types: text, date, search, url, tel, email, and password.

content.text: Tip: Use the global title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user.
content.html: Tip: Use the global title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user.

content.text: Tip: Learn more about regular expressions in our JavaScript tutorial.
content.html: Tip: Learn more about regular expressions in our JavaScript tutorial.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<input type="text" id="country_code" name="country_code"  
  pattern="[A-Za-z]{3}" title="Three letter country code">

type="text" id="country_code" name="country_code"  
  pattern="[A-Za-z]{3}" title="Three letter country code"

content.code:
<form>
  <label for="country_code">Country code:</label>
  
<input type="text" id="country_code" name="country_code"  
pattern="[A-Za-z]{3}" title="Three letter country code">
</form>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<input type="text" id="country_code" name="country_code"  
  pattern="[A-Za-z]{3}" title="Three letter country code">

type="text" id="country_code" name="country_code"  
  pattern="[A-Za-z]{3}" title="Three letter country code"

content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="country_code">Country code:</label>
  <input type="text" id="country_code" name="country_code"
  pattern="[A-Za-z]{3}" title="Three letter country code">
</form>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<input type="text" id="country_code" name="country_code"  
  pattern="[A-Za-z]{3}" title="Three letter country code">

type="text" id="country_code" name="country_code"  
  pattern="[A-Za-z]{3}" title="Three letter country code"

content.text: The placeholder Attribute
The input placeholder attribute specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of an input field (a sample value or a short description of the expected format).
content.html: The input placeholder attribute specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of an input field (a sample value or a short description of the expected format).

content.text: The short hint is displayed in the input field before the user enters a value.
content.html: The short hint is displayed in the input field before the user enters a value.

content.text: The placeholder attribute works with the following input types: text, search, url, number, tel, email, and password.
content.html: The placeholder attribute works with the following input types: text, search, url, number, tel, email, and password.

content.code:
<form>
  <label for="phone">Enter a phone number:</label>
  
<input type="tel" id="phone" name="phone"  
placeholder="123-45-678"  pattern="[0-9]{3}-[0-9]{2}-[0-9]{3}">

</form>
content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="phone">Enter a phone number:</label>
  <input type="tel" id="phone" name="phone"
  placeholder="123-45-678"
  pattern="[0-9]{3}-[0-9]{2}-[0-9]{3}">
</form>

content.text: The required Attribute
The input required attribute specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form.
content.html: The input required attribute specifies that an input field must be filled out before submitting the form.

content.text: The required attribute works with the following input types: text, search, url, tel, email, password, date pickers, number, checkbox, radio, and file.
content.html: The required attribute works with the following input types: text, search, url, tel, email, password, date pickers, number, checkbox, radio, and file.

content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="username">Username:</label>
  <input type="text" id="username" name="username" required>
</form>

content.text: The step Attribute
The input step attribute specifies the legal number intervals for an input field.
content.html: The input step attribute specifies the legal number intervals for an input field.

content.text: Example: if step="3", legal numbers could be -3, 0, 3, 6, etc.
content.html: Example: if step="3", legal numbers could be -3, 0, 3, 6, etc.

content.text: Tip: This attribute can be used together with the max and min attributes to create a range of legal values.
content.html: Tip: This attribute can be used together with the max and min attributes to create a range of legal values.

content.text: The step attribute works with the following input types: number, range, date, datetime-local, month, time and week.
content.html: The step attribute works with the following input types: number, range, date, datetime-local, month, time and week.

content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="points">Points:</label>
  <input type="number" id="points" name="points" step="3">
</form>

content.text: Note: Input restrictions are not foolproof, and JavaScript provides many ways to add illegal input. To safely restrict input, it must also be checked by the receiver (the server)!
content.html: Note: Input restrictions are not foolproof, and JavaScript provides many ways to add illegal input. To safely restrict input, it must also be checked by the receiver (the server)!

content.text: The autofocus Attribute
The input autofocus attribute specifies that an input field should automatically get focus when the page loads.
content.html: The input autofocus attribute specifies that an input field should automatically get focus when the page loads.

content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="fname">First name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname" autofocus><br>
  <label for="lname">Last name:</label><br>
  <input type="text" id="lname" name="lname">
</form>

content.text: The height and width Attributes
The input height and width attributes specify the height and width of an <input type="image"> element.
content.html: The input height and width attributes specify the height and width of an <input type="image"> element.

content.text: Tip: Always specify both the height and width attributes for images. If height and width are set, the space required for the image is reserved when the page is loaded. Without these attributes, the browser does not know the size of the image, and cannot reserve the appropriate space to it. The effect will be that the page layout will change during loading (while the images load).
content.html: Tip: Always specify both the height and width attributes for images. If height and width are set, the space required for the image is reserved when the page is loaded. Without these attributes, the browser does not know the size of the image, and cannot reserve the appropriate space to it. The effect will be that the page layout will change during loading (while the images load).

content.code_html:
<form>
  <label for="fname">First name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname"><br><br>
  <label for="lname">Last name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="lname" name="lname"><br><br>
  <input type="image" src="img_submit.gif" alt="Submit" width="48" height="48">
</form>

content.text: The list Attribute
The input list attribute refers to a <datalist> element that contains pre-defined options for an <input> element.
content.html: The input list attribute refers to a <datalist> element that contains pre-defined options for an <input> element.

content.code:
<form>
 
<input list="browsers">
 
<datalist id="browsers">

<option value="Edge">


<option value="Firefox">


<option value="Chrome">


<option value="Opera">


<option value="Safari">


</datalist>
</form>
content.code_html:
<form>
  <input list="browsers">
  <datalist id="browsers">
    <option value="Edge">
    <option value="Firefox">
    <option value="Chrome">
    <option value="Opera">
    <option value="Safari">
  </datalist>
</form>

content.text: The autocomplete Attribute
The input autocomplete attribute specifies whether a form or an input field should have autocomplete on or off.
content.html: The input autocomplete attribute specifies whether a form or an input field should have autocomplete on or off.

content.text: Autocomplete allows the browser to predict the value. When a user starts to type in a field, the browser should display options to fill in the field, based on earlier typed values.
content.html: Autocomplete allows the browser to predict the value. When a user starts to type in a field, the browser should display options to fill in the field, based on earlier typed values.

content.text: The autocomplete attribute works with <form> and the following <input> types: text, search, url, tel, email, password, datepickers, range, and color.
content.html: The autocomplete attribute works with <form> and the following <input> types: text, search, url, tel, email, password, datepickers, range, and color.

content.code_html:
<form action="/action_page.php" autocomplete="on">
  <label for="fname">First name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="fname" name="fname"><br><br>
  <label for="lname">Last name:</label>
  <input type="text" id="lname" name="lname"><br><br>
  <label for="email">Email:</label>
  <input type="email" id="email" name="email" autocomplete="off"><br><br>
  <input type="submit" value="Submit">
</form>

content.text: Tip: In some browsers you may need to activate an autocomplete function for this to work (Look under "Preferences" in the browser's menu).
content.html: Tip: In some browsers you may need to activate an autocomplete function for this to work (Look under "Preferences" in the browser's menu).

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the default value of the INPUT element's size attribute?
content.html: What is the default value of the INPUT element's size attribute?

content.text: HTML Form and Input Elements

content.code_html:
Tag Description
<form> Defines an HTML form for user input
<input> Defines an input control

content.text: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
